bug.author: ghost(ghost)
bug.description:
I have been working through a successful web-install on clean ubuntu 14.04 The requirements only stated to have driver 346 - so I haven't downloaded cuDNN or graphviz When I attempt to visualize a network (visualize button ) when building a model <denchmark-link:https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7809322/7074866/58d24962-dec3-11e4-8944-ca976de446b9.png></denchmark-link>
I return this error <denchmark-link:https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7809322/7074876/729ef818-dec3-11e4-93a3-d4ba37f44dc7.png></denchmark-link>
Do i need to get graphviz and cuDNN on my own? Thanks and my apologies if this is the wrong place for this question. Great work

comments.comment: Ah, it looks like we left out a line in the "one_time.sh" script. I'll make sure that's fixed for the next packaged version. Thanks for reporting it! For now, if you want to use the visualization tool, you can manually run this command: <denchmark-code>sudo apt-get install graphviz </denchmark-code>
